main: ^How have things been since I left?
^Maria! Oh, it's been alright. We're far enough out that things don't tend to wander our way.
^Good. I just went into town, and... it was not so fortunate.
^O-oh. I'm so s-sorry to hear that, Maria.
^Just focus on the people here, for now. You all need to make it through this, at least. Someone does.
^I do have a question, though. Do you remember anything strange from your time at Manifest? The kinds of things that made you want to leave?
^W-well, it seemed okay when I started. Wasn't great, but you'd told me to expect as much. But the longer I stayed, it started to change...
^They had me posted at this r-railyard, working on engines and preparing track material. I d-don't much like talking about that place.
^But there was one time when I walked into the company clinic for a patch-up, and the doc wasn't at his desk. So I figured he must be in back.
^I peaked my head in, and what I s-saw... r-red all over the ground, body parts... and something like a pick shoved into someone's h-head.
^That is enough, Ephraim. Thank you for sharing that with me.
^O-oh, alright then. Are you leaving again? So soon?
^I am. For the last time, I hope. I will see you when I get back. Until then, just try to stay calm. Beth will get you anything you need.
^I know, Maria. Thank you. And good luck!
